featured.text: One reason the earthquake caused such damage was that Bam's buildings were made mostly from baked mud.
The moment the students felt the earthquake, they ran ______ out of the classroom to an open area outside.
No one can possibly know _________ when an earthquake will strike.
Dogs bark before earthquakes; cattle predict rainfall by sitting on the ground.

other.text: A movement of 25 a few millimeters (mm) of the earth’s crust is a sign of possible earthquakes.
Which of the following is CORRECT about the earthquake in Bam? (A) About 50,000 people survived the earthquake.
The old houses will soon be and rebuilt because of the severe damage caused by the earthquake.

definition.zh_def: 地震是地球表面因地殼運動而產生的震動現象。
definition.en_def: An earthquake is a sudden shaking of the ground caused by the movement of tectonic plates.
definition.example: The earthquake caused significant damage to the buildings in the city.
